body.p:
Page 1
State of Kentucky
Marion Circuit Court } Sct

Caption
Pleas before Hon George W Kavanaugh Judge of the Marion Circuit Court at the courthouse in Lebanon on the 29th Day of November 1861.

Style of action
Commonwealth Plff
vs } On forfeited bail bond. No 2.
John W Morgan Deft

Be it remembered that at a regular term of the Marion Circuit court towit May the 26th 1859. The Grand Jury empannelled and Sworn in and for Marion County at Said term among other Indictments returned into court One against J Smith alias J Brower and Wm Daniel for Setting up and exhibiting and keeping a Faro bank (No 2.) endorsed by M J Cecil the foreman thereof a true Bill. And is as follows towit:

Marion Circuit Court
Indictment
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
J Smith alias J Brower & Wm Daniel

The Grand Jury of Marion County in the name and by the authority of the commonwealth of Kentucky accuse J Smith (alias J Brower) & Wm Daniel of the offence of Setting up exhibiting & Keeping a Faro bank committted as follows. The Said J Smith alias J Brower On the 18th Day of April 1859. in the county aforesaid did unlawfully Set up exhibit & Keep a Faro bank a contrivance whereby money or other thing was & might have been bet lost or won against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Andy Barnett
attorney for Commonwealth

witness before jury
Thos Chandler
Wm S Robinson
Benj Simms

Endorsement of foreman on Indictment
And upon the back of the above indictment is the following endorsement of the foreman

True Bill
M J Cecil foreman of Grand Jury

clerks endorsement filing indict
And upon the back of the above indictment is the following clerks endorsement of filing the Same

3
Filed May 26/59
N T Berry ck

Order for bench not to issue
And on the Same day of Said Term on motion of the attorney for the commonwealth there was an order made awarding a bench warrant on the above and other Indictments admitting the defendants to bail in the Sum of Six hundred dollars each
And on the 20th Day of Sept 1859 there was issued by the clerk of Said court the following Bench warrant towit:
Marion Circuit Court

Bench warrant
The Commonwealth of Kentucky

To any Sheriff Constable Corner Marsahl or Policeman in this State You are hereby commanded forthwith to arrest J Smith alias J Brower & William Daniels and bring them before the Marion Circuit court to answer an indictment in that court against them for misdemeanor; or if the court be adjourned for the term, that you deliver them to the Jailer of Marion County Given under my hand as clerk of said court this 20th Day of Sept 1859.
N T Berry C M C C.

p.note:
4
Upon the back of the above bench warrant is the following endorsement. towit:

body.p:
Endorsement of bail on bench wt.
The defendants may give bail in the Sum of Six hundred dollars each and if they desire to give Such bail it may be taken by the Sheriff of the county in which they are arrested or by the Sheriff of Marion County
N T Berry C M C C
And upon Said bench warrant is the following Sheriffs return towit:

Sheriffs endorsement & return on bench wt
Executed on Wm H Daniel 22nd March 1860. See bond returned herewith the other defendant not found.

J C Vanansdall D. S.
For G W Tompkins S M C
The bond refered to in the above return is a follows towit:

Wiliam H Daniel being in custody charged with the offence of dealing Faro and being admitted to bail in the Sum of Six hundred dollars now I John W Morgan of the county of Mercer and State of Kentucky hereby undertake that the above bound Wm H.
5
hereby undertake that the above bound Wm H Daniel will appear in the Marion circuit court on the first day of its next May Term to answer Said charge and will at all times render himself amenable to the order & process of Said Court. in the prossecution of Said charge and if convicted will render himself in execution thereof or if he Shall fail to perform either of these conditions that I will pay to the commonwealth of Ky the Sum of Six Hundred dollars witness our hands this 22nd Day of March 1860.
J. W. Morgan
Taken and Subscribed to before me as Deputy for Geo W Tompkins Sheriff of Mercer county this 22nd Day of March 1860.

J C Vanansdall D S
For Geo W Tompkins S M C
And at a regular term of the Marion Circuit Court towit: May 29th 1860 there was made the following order.

Judgment confessed by Wm Daniels
Commonwealth Plff
vs } Faro Bank
J Smith alias J Brower and William Daniel } Defts
6

This day the defendant William Daniel came in upon Court and by consent of the attorney for the Commonwealth confessed judgment in the Sum of five hundred dollars It is therefore adjudged that Said defendant make his fine to the commonwealth of Ky by the payment of five hundred dollars the amount confessed as aforesaid and also the costs herein expended. and this came in continued as to defendant Brower and an alias is awarded against him.
And on the 28th day of June 1860 there was issued upon the above judgment the following capias towit:

Capias upon the Judgment
The Commonwealth of Kentucky

To the Sheriff of Marion County Greeting. we command you to take the body of William Daniels late of Said county if he be found within the Same and him Safely keep until he Shall Satisfy us $500. dollars which we late in our circuit court recovered against him for keeping a faro bank against our peace and dignity also the Sum of Seven dollars and 20 cents which to us in the Same court was
7
adjudged for our costs in that behalf whereof the Said Deft is convicted as appears to us of record: And how you Shall have executed this writ make known to our judge of our Said Court at the courthouse thereof in the Town of Lebanon On the 2nd Monday in August next. And have then there this writ. witness N T Berry clerk of our Said court at the courthouse aforesaid the 28th Day of June 1860.
N T Berry C. M. C. C.
And upon Said Capias is the following Sheriffs return towit:

Shffs return on capias
Wm Daniels not found this the 13th day of August 1860
E. Kimberlin D S for G W Goodman S M C
And at a further term of Said Court towit: June the 5th 1861. There was make the following order:

Order forfeiting bond
Commonwealth Plff
vs } Indict for Faro bank No 1
J Smith alias J Brower. and William Daniel } Defts

It appearing to the Satisfaction
8
of the Court that at the May term 1860 Judgment was rendered herein against defendant William Daniels for the Sum of five hundred dollars upon which judgment there was an Execution issued against Said Daniels which was duly returned by E Kimberlin Deputy Shff of Marion County (William Daniel not found.) and it further appearing that John W Morgan executed a bond to the Commonwealth of Kentucky in the Sum of Six hundred dollars conditioned among other things that the Said Morgan would at all times render himself amenable to the orders and process of this court and the Said Morgan failing to render himself amenable to the orders and process of Said Court Said bond is declared forfeited. It is therefore ordered that a Summons issue on Said forfeiture against Said John W Morgan returnable to the next term of this court.
And on the 22nd Day of July 1861. There was issued the following Summons towit:

Summons on forfeiture
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
To the Sheriff of Mercer County
9
Greeting. You are commanded to summon John W Morgan to appear in the Marion Circuit Court on the first day of its next August term to Show cause why Judgment Should not be rendered against him for Six hundred dollars on account of the forfeiture of the bail bond executed by him for the appearance &c of William Daniels in said Court at its May term 1860 and have then and there this writ with due return how you have executed it Given under my hand as clerk of Said court this 22nd day of Juy 1861.
N T Berry ck M C C
And upon Said Summons is the following Sheriff return towit:

Shffs return on Sums
Executed July 25th 1861. On John W Morgan by delivering him a true copy of the within Summary
S S McFatrige S M C
And at a further term of Said court towit August 21st 1861. there was made the following order.

10
Order filing ans & demr of Deft
The Commonwealth Plff
vs } On foreiture No 1.
John W Morgan Deft
This day came the defendant by his attorney and filed his answer and demurer. herein and the court not being advised take time &c
The answer filed as above is as follws towit:

Marion Circuit Court
Answer of Deft
Commonwealth of Kentucky Plff
against } On Recognizance No 1
John W Morgan Deft

The defendant John W Morgan for answer to the Plffs Summons herein Says that the Said William H Daniels did appear in the Marion circuit court on the first day of its May term 1860. and continued in Said Court till the 29th day of May 1860. On which Said last named day he confessed Judgment in open court for $500. & costs which Judgment was accepted by th Commonwealth by her attorney in open court and the Said William H Daniels was then and there ready to Surrender himself in execution of Said Judgment
11
And the Commonwealth failed and neglected to ask the court to commit him to Jail or to ask or receive his commitment. whereupon the Said Daniel returned to the county of Mercer his place of residence where he has continued to be & reside ever Since & his place of residence has been all that time well known to A Barnett Esqr attorney for the Commonwealth and no Capias or Execution has been issued or Sent to that county to arrest Said Daniel nor has his body been at any time demanded in execution of Said Judgment whereupon he prays that Said Summons be dismissed
J W Morgan
J W Morgan Says he believes the Statements made in the foregoing answer are true
Jno W Morgan
Sworn to by J W Morgan before me this 19th day of Aug 1861.

Thos C Woods
Chm of Leb.

The Demurer filed by Defendant is as follows towit:
12
Marion Circuit Court
Demurer of Deft
Commonwealth Plff
vs } On Recognizance No 1. Demurer.
John W Morgan Deft
The Defendant John W Morgan demurs to the Summons and proceedings herein. because the court has no jurisdiction of the Subject of the action -- Wherefore he prays the Same be dismissed &c

Shuch & Woods
attys for Deft
And at a further day of Said term towit: August 23rd 1861. there was made the following order.

Order overruling demr of deft & Plff filed demur to Defts ans & demr Sust. & time given deft to ans
Commonwealth Plff
vs } On forfeiture No 1
John W Morgan Deft

The court being advised as to the demurer filed by the defendant overrules Said demurer. to which defendant excepts and Plff filed demurer to the answer of defendant and the Court being advised Sustains Said dermurer to which defendant execpts and time until the next term of this court is given defendant to answer further.

13
The demurer filed by Plaintiff is as follows towit:
Demurer filed by Plff
Marion Circuit Court
Comth Plff
vs } On forf Recognizance Demurer to Defts ansr
John Morgan Deft
The Plff demurers to defts answer because he Says it Sets up no valid defence to this action & is otherwise informal & defective
Andy Barnett atty for Comth
And at a further term of Said court towit: November 29th 1861. there was made the following order towit:

Judgment
Commonwealth Plff
vs } On forfeited Recognzance No 1
John W Morgan Deft

This day came the attorney for the commonwealth and the defendant failing further to plead herein It is adjudged that he pay to the Commonwealth the Sum of five hundred dollars the amt of the forfeiture herein and also the costs herein
14
State of Kentucky
Marion Circuit Court } Sct

I N T Berry clerk of the Marion Circuit Court certify that the thirteen foregoing pages contain a full true and complete transcript of the record and proceedings had therein in said court in the case of the Commonwealth against J Smith alias J Brower & Wm Daniels for Faro bank No 1. Als a true copy of the record and proceedings had on the bond of John W Morgan executed in Said case Given under my hand as clerk aforesaid this 7th Day of February 1862.
N T Berry ck
